paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the BRCA2 variant c.68-7T>A, its association with breast cancer, and provides penetrance data for carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Ductal cancer; 15 mm; high grade; ER negative; PR negative
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient 1 was diagnosed with breast cancer at age 58.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Ductal cancer; high grade; 35 mm; ER positive; PR positive
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient 2 was diagnosed with breast cancer at age 68.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Ductal cancer; high grade; 30 mm; ER negative; PR negative
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient 3 was diagnosed with breast cancer at first examination at age 40.

functional_data.summary: The variant causes aberrant splicing, potentially leading to lower penetrance.

variants.additional_notes: The variant may have lower penetrance than average pathogenic BRCA2 variants.
key_quotes: BRCA2 c.68-7T>A is associated with breast cancer.
It is, however, possible that the variant has lower penetrance than the average pathogenic BRCA2 variants.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
